definition: to walk a tightrope (literally or figuratively)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc

sentences.english: The audience held their breath as the acrobat walked along the tightrope .
sentences.chinese: 雜技演員走鋼絲時，觀從們都屏住了呼吸。

sentences.english: He used to walk on a tightrope across the Niagara Falls.
sentences.chinese: 他常走鋼絲來跨越尼亞拉加瀑布。

sentences.english: The children were all strung up over the show of wire-walking.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們在看走鋼絲表演時都緊張極了。

sentences.english: This person holds his balance while moving forward.
sentences.chinese: 走鋼絲的人靠向前移動來保持他的平衡。

sentences.english: In July 2007, an acrobat cycles the high-wire – a stunning feat.
sentences.chinese: 月，一名雜技團演員在表演高空自行車走鋼絲絕技。
